inventory.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] DESIGN NP2[patient] (PP{P NP[recipient]) NP1[agent] DESIGN NP2[patient] (PP{P NP[goal])

sense.name: create or invent, often via models or sketches
sense.examples: Who designed these beautiful couture evening gowns? Their firm designs custom chips for graphics applications. A well-known architect actually designed the addition to their house. Our form of government is designed around three main branches of power.

sense.name: concoct or scheme, contrive a plan
sense.examples: He'd better design some excuse for why he is late again! They fear insurgents are designing an overthrow of the king. The child designed a way to sneak through the milk chute and get cookies from the neighbor's apartment.

sense.name: intend or have a purpose
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent[human]] DESIGN NP2[goal] Note: often occurs in the passive with an implied subject.
sense.examples: Mary's sister designs to go far in her field of research. John designs to say that... She designs to go down to the village.
